content: this is just a normal piece of black poster board and I'm going to use this
for the road so what I'm going to do to start out is I'm gonna have two sections
of road one going to the one going to the bridge and one leg away from the
other side of the bridge so what I'm going to do is I'm going to draw some
roads so what I'll do is you could use cardboard block you just use poster
board it's real easy so what I'll do is I'll just put my yardstick down then I'm
going to measure just across the poster board and I'm gonna do it twice because
I want the route of the big I'm just using my t-square so now I'm gonna do
the other part of the road now these are definitely not modern time so the roads
aren't straight like this I'm just getting this - using this to get my
reference now I'm using pencil you probably can't see it very well on the
video but I use pencil because it's much easier to see on the black poster board
so what I've got is I've got my two roads so I'm gonna draw the edge but I'm
gonna do it a bit irregular so when I cut it out it
doesn't just look like a straight line now I'll do this one
so now what I'll do is I'll cut these out and then I'm going to paint them
since the roads were so hard to see while I was drawing on the post-award
since it's dark I want to show you what they look like so I just did the edges a
little bit of regular to make it look like a dirt road now I use black poster
board instead of white because it's already black so I have to base paint it
black so it's all ready to go now what I will you use on these is a texture paint
it's a brown texture paint instead of a the gray stone color texture paint and
that'll just make it look like a dirt road so I will spray that on and I'll
show you what that looks like here I've got my section of road and
I've sprayed it with the ground texture paint I've done a little bit of black
streaking on it I want to make it look like it's being used so but what I'm
gonna do now is I'm going to use a cinnamon paint and I'm going to add some
streaks like in wagon wheel ruts and things
so I'm going to thin the paint fairly well and I'll just kind of drag
feel it's too light you can always add some more paint that kind of gives the
road a little interest and remember the paint always looks a little drier on a
panel more on the edge the paint or the paint always looks a little brighter
when you first paint it on it will darken up a bit so keep that in mind
when you paint if you're worried about it being too bright you can always do a
test and then when it dries you can see that what if it's the degree of color
you want so there we go paint that and I'll do the other road
piece and then we'll move on from here here's something else I was going to use
in a scenario and I wanted to show it to you before you saw it and we're
wondering what was going on this is very similar to the tree bases I have done
it's that same type of wood just cut in a random oval shape now you'll see that
I don't have trees on this I've got smaller plants these are basically just
aquarium type plants that what I've done is I have drilled through the bottom and
stuck the plants through and then I glued them in with some epoxy glue the
kind you mixed together it's very strong so I stuck them through and if it was
when I stuck them through the hole I drilled a hole through the wood and when
I stuck them through I used the epoxy glue and if there is any sticking
through the bottom I just snipped it off with some scissors so basically I just
did this you know the very similar technique to make this as I did for the
trees I just instead of gluing the tree bases on I drilled through the base and
then stuck the plants through now one thing about this is it's not to bad that
they are permanently on here because they're flexible so I don't have to
worry about them breaking off in this and it's not as big of a storage issue
because they're not as tall so I just wanted to show you that before we moved
on before you saw it in the final scenario more like where'd that come
from I had one more thing to I had also had
some individual plants so here's an individual plant
I'll bring that a little closer as you can see it so basically it's the same
type of plants I've used on the base but what I did was I used some just air dry
clay and molded into the cone shape and stuck the plant in there so and then I
sprayed a little bit of the dirt texture paint around the base a little bit gets
in the plant that's okay it just adds to it but it's pretty easy just to spray
that on the base even with the plants in it so you can see that's you'll see
these in the scenario - I'll put a few of these on the rocks crossing the gorge
so I want to know you know let you know how I made those and now we'll move on
you
